qas.question: What magazine broke the story of Paul VI pending saint hood?
What type of miracle was attributed to Pope Paul VI?
What group declared the healing a miracle by Paul VI?

answers.text: The Congregation for the Causes of Saints

qas.question: Who needed to approve the Congregation for the Causes of Saints conclusion that Paul VI performed a miracle?
Who was required to sign a decree declaring Paul VI a saint?

context: On 24 April 2014, it was reported in the Italian magazine <a0_0>Credere<a0_0/> that the late pope could possibly be beatified on 19 October 2014. This report from the magazine further stated that several cardinals and bishops would meet on 5 May to confirm the miracle that had previously been approved, and then present it to <a4_0>Pope Francis<a4_0/> who may sign the decree for beatification shortly after that. <a2_0>The Congregation for the Causes of Saints<a2_0/> held that meeting and positively concluded that the <a1_0>healing<a1_0/> was indeed a miracle that could be attributed to the late pope. The matter shall now soon be presented to the <a3_0>pope<a3_0/> for approval.
